result.execSummary:
Ralph Leon Perdue was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Ralph Leon Perdue was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ralph Leon Perdue

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ralph Leon Perdue not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant has been turned over to the State of Minnesota on April 29, 2014.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Ralph Leon Perdue in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Ralph Leon Perdue in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Minnesota.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
